question: Scarcely had the minister started his speech ___ the crowd began to chant slogans.
Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
options: I look forward to meeting you.
I look forward to meet you.
I am looking forward to meet you.
I look forward for meeting you.
I looking forward to meeting you.

question: Choose the synonym of 'Ephemeral'.
If I ___ you, I would have accepted the offer immediately.
Identify the error: 'Neither of the two candidates were suitable for the job.'
She is one of those people who ___ never satisfied.
The jury ___ divided in their opinions regarding the verdict.
He would not have failed if he ___ to his teacher's advice.
Choose the correct indirect speech: He said, 'I must go now.'
options: He said that he must go then.
He said that he had to go then.
He said that he must went then.
He said that he has to go now.
He says that he must go then.

question: The phrase 'to sit on the fence' means:
___ rich should help the poor.
It is high time we ___ home.
One word substitution: 'A person who does not believe in the existence of God.'
The police ___ investigating the case.
Choose the antonym of 'Benevolent'.
Hardly had I reached the station ___ the train left.
Let's go for a walk, ___?
He is addicted ___ gambling.
Identify the correct sentence.
options: He is more senior than me.
He is the most senior than me.

question: The climatic conditions of the region ___ strictly harsh.
Not only the students but also the teacher ___ present.
The word 'Ubiquitous' means:
Choose the correct sentence arrangement: P: achieved Q: has R: he S: success
Despite ___ hard, he failed the exam.
He behaves as if he ___ the boss.
We look forward to ___ from you soon.
Identify the incorrect part: 'Ten miles are a long distance to walk.'
She has a predilection ___ classical music.
By this time next year, I ___ my degree.
The idiom 'To let the cat out of the bag' means:
He denied ___ the money.
Which of these is a collective noun?
Had I known about the party, I ___ attended it.
Choose the correct spelling.
Much of the advice he gave ___ useless.
My brother deals ___ sugar.
He deals ___ his customers very politely.
I prefer tea ___ coffee.
The number of students in the class ___ increasing.
A number of students ___ absent today.
It is I who ___ to blame for this mistake.
The Secretary and Treasurer ___ attending the meeting.
___ a rainy day, we decided to stay indoors.
Many a soldier ___ his life for the country.
More than one workman ___ killed in the accident.
Not until the rain stopped ___ allowed to leave.
The judge ordered that the prisoner ___ released immediately.
I would rather you ___ home now.
Five hours ___ a long time to wait for a train.
I made him ___ the entire letter.
